intro: Mattiastrum sarawschanicum, commonly known as the Sarawak spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
